Merge pull request #392 from martin-belanger/rc6

nvme-stas 2.3-rc6

release: nvme-stas 2.3-rc6

Signed-off-by: Martin Belanger <martin.belanger@dell.com>

avahi: Add retry mechanism on TCP checker code

We found that SFSS advertises (mDNS) its services before it is even
listening for connections. If a host responds too quickly to Avahi
detection of the CDC and tries to connect before the CDC is actually
listening, we will get the connection refused error.

SFSS should only advertise its service with mDNS when it is ready
to receive connections. However, nvme-stas will now have a retry
mechanism in case SFSS cannot fix this issue.

Signed-off-by: Martin Belanger <martin.belanger@dell.com>

Merge pull request #379 from martin-belanger/v2.3-rc3

trid: Take Host NQN into account

trid: Take Host NQN into account

When booting from SAN (BFS), the Host NQN specified in the NBFT
files is often different from the Host NQN specified in
/etc/nvme/hostnqn. Therefore, connections made after the system
is fully booted will be made with a different Host NQN than the
connections made during boot. nvme-stas did not consider the Host
NQN when scanning for existing connections, which means that it
would reuse a BFS connection when in fact it needed to create a
new one using a different Host NQN.

Note that the same issue is seen in nvme-cli and libnvme as well.
These will need to be fixed separately.

Signed-off-by: Martin Belanger <martin.belanger@dell.com>

Merge pull request #375 from linux-nvme/dependabot/github_actions/docker/metadata-action-4.6.0

build(deps): bump docker/metadata-action from 4.5.0 to 4.6.0

avahi: add connectivity checker to verify IP addresses are reachable

Signed-off-by: Martin Belanger <martin.belanger@dell.com>

stafd|ctrl: Do not recreate ctrl object on nvme removed events

On kernel events indicating that an nvme device associated with
a discovery controller was removed by the kernel, stafd should not
delete the old ctrl object and create a new one to kick-start the
reconnect process. This causes the cached DLPEs to be lost, which
may result in stacd disconnecting from I/O controllers. Instead,
simply restart the "try to connect" timer, while stafd is trying
to reconnect, the DLPEs will be preserved, which will allow stacd
to maintain existing I/O controller connections.

Signed-off-by: Martin Belanger <martin.belanger@dell.com>
